text: Consider a hard disk with a seek time of 10 milliseconds and rotational speed of 6000 rotations per minute (RPM). It has 500 sectors per track and each sector can store 500 bytes of data. Consider a file stored in the disk. The file contains 1000 sectors. Assume that every sector access necessitates a seek, and the average rotational latency for accessing each sector is half of the time for one complete rotation. The total time (in milliseconds) needed to read the entire file is .
